review_title: Rating Christus St. Vincent Regional Medical Center
job_title: Medical Records in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Working at Christus was always rewarding and satisfying. The Medical Center is very important to the city and its environs, being in the desert city of Santa Fe, NM. Going to practically every department and several other buildings to collect medical records every day, you get to know many people who work hard to help those in need. It is gratifying work, and I enjoyed every minute of being part of the Medical Records Department.
cons: I honestly cannot think of a single con. I worked witha great group of people.

review_title: Demanding work, ON every second, start shift at 0730

review_title: Great place to work and grow!
job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Had endless opportunities to grow my skill set and be mentored.
cons: Health care is a moving target and requires one to be flexible.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Pay and benefits were decent. Some co-workers were okay. The coffee stand. Location was convenient
cons: Hard work was not rewarded. People who are good don't stick around and the lazy employees stay forever. Managers play favorites. Not a very professional environment overall.

review_title: CMS 5 star rating means you have happy employees, one of the best rated employers in NM.
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Leadership recognizes the importance of quality care and has made it a priority in everything they do. The CDPI program allows all of the staff to contribute to quality improvement CSVRMC is now affiliated with the Mayo Clinic through this program.
cons: Really busy ED with more than its fair share of drug and alcohol abuse.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Santa Fe, NM

review_title: They don't follow their own policies or twist them to try and fire you
job_title: Registered Polysomnographic Technologist in Santa Fe, NM
pros:
Decent pay and recognition from my manger when I did good work. 
The union got them to overturn the termination to a resignation because they knew that I could have sued them and I still can and might.
cons: He stabbed me in the back and him and HR did not follow their own policy. I had 72 hours to notify them of an incident that happened at my home on off time. The policy was nothing I ever heard of but they said I signed the paper in orientation that I would follow the company policies. Why sign something when it;s your first day and you have not had time to read policies. Truly how many employees read every policy online? They put me on administrative leave before the 72 hrs was up for me to report the incident. He threw me under the bus so he looked good to administration instead of having a backbone and sticking up for me.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Houston, TX
pros: There are still a few good people left working there, but for the most part the really smart ones got out.
cons: Too many to list. Upper management is horrendous. The "not-for-profit" hospital tries to convince the community, by using millions of dollars on marketing, to believe that the patient is their number one priority. The patients, like the staff, are only numbers to them.  The community hates this hospital more than ever, and it was not very popular ten years ago. Money, and making lots of it, are the primary objective. This organization will turn a blind eye to warnings of something going wrong, like drug addicts working in the Emergency Dept. or ICU.  They don't want to know about it. Now, the main competition, Presbyterian, which is local favorite in New Mexico, is building a hospital in Santa Fe. CHRISTUS St. Vincent is a sinking ship, and the rats will be jumping ship in big numbers. CHRISTUS Health might opt out by the time Presbyterian opens its hospital.

review_title: If you can tolerate a corporate, Catholic approach to healthcare, this company may be for you.
job_title: Clinical Social Worker/Therapist in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Good work environment if you are working at one of their clinics rather than in the hospital.  Great pay and benefits.  Good customer service for employees.
cons: Although they are a non-profit, they are profit driven and the balance sheet is always the bottom line.  Executives are accessible but non responsive; they merely give lip service.  If a patient does not have insurance/good insurance and/or have behavioral health problems, they are treated very poorly, if at all.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Fe, NM
pros: The salary was good until they decided to lower it after a year.
cons: Some of the employees are completely incompetent, are lazy, and dangerous.  They also run the hospital.  The union is completely crooked.  They hired me at a certain salary, and lowered it by more than $7 an hour because of a disgruntled employee.  She was high up in the union, and went to HR and said I was making too much money.  How she knew my salary?  Unknown to me, yet they tried to blame me saying I told everyone how much I made.  When I quit, I filed unemployment since I quit under duress, and they fought it saying I quit for no good reason.  Luckily the Judge sided with me.

review_title: Great hospital dont listen to the bad publicity
job_title: Athletic Trainer in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Christus gets a bad reputation in the community but they have been a great hospital to work for and to get treated at. They have made strides each year I have been there improving their relations with the community. Even getting all private rooms in the upcoming future.
cons: People in the community think its a bad hospital just because one person may have told them so 10 years ago.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Fe, NM
pros: My experience at CSV started as a nursing student doing my clinicals. Upon graduation, I started my career as a circulating nurse in the operating room. I have experienced the company continually grow and improve into a world class facility that delivers excellent patient care for its community and visitors.
cons: Unfortunately, like many other organizations, the company has to rely heavily on traveler staff.

cons: The nurse to patient ratio is too high leading to easy burnout and unhappy patients, always short staffed
